page.title: 02Education-Whittlebury School
page.content: The school is hidden behind the old school house at 61 High Street. It was completed in 1820 in stone by local people. Recent additions are in brick with slate roofs. There are two classrooms. In July 1985 there were 44 pupils comprising 25 juniors aged 7-11 years and 19 infants aged 4-7 years. There are 5 teachers 2 of whom are full-time, a secretary, a lunch-time supervisor and a cleaner. All pupils go weekly to Towcester for swimming. Pupils perform an annual Nativity Play and present an end of school year concert. There is a trip to the theatre every year and in the summer a school camp. Friends of the school raise money to supply valuable extras, including printer and disc-drive for the RML480Z computer, overhead projector, games equipment.
